title: Add new report filter called: “Equal to today + (x) days”
author: Kim Teck
content: Account: University of Minnesota PhysiciansContact: Shawn O'NeillEmail: soneill@umn.eduEnhancement RequestI would like to see a new report filter added called: “Equal to today + (x) days”Expanded QuoteI discovered with the help of your support team that the “Greater than Today + (x) days” does not work as advertised in the help documentation. It returns data AFTER the number of days I key in, not WITHIN the number of day I key in. The workaround support told me to use was to use “Less than today + (x) days” AND then key in a date after xx/xx/2023, so previous events will not be included. Having to key in a hard date each time goes against the automated nature of the report we want to build. See case # 00836242Another workaround was to set two filters, a "Greater Than Today + (x) | 0" and a "Less Than Today + (x) | 365" filter so that it would include any records between the start date from the Greater filter and the end date from the Lesser filter. title: Duration reports should automatically be reported in Conga as a numeric value
author: Kim Teck
content:
EXPANDED QUOTE

My concerns are: (1) the format of the duration reports, are being reported only as mixed text (e.g., 6 days, 23 hours, 45 minutes, 13 seconds) rather than numbers only (e.g., 06:23:45:13 [Days:Hours:Minutes:Seconds]), which is preventing me from building any meaningful reports in Excel based on time because Excel cannot filter time based on the mixed text format that re being produced from Conga; and (2) the duration report being produced is based on "Business Day" as opposed to 24 hour period, which seems odd (what is a "Business Day" (e.g. US Federal Holidays excluded, State holidays excluded (which State), weekends excluded)


WHAT PROBLEM DO YOU INTEND TO RESOLVE WITH THE REQUESTED FUNCTIONALITY?

(1) Duration reports simply do NOT work in Conga because of the mixed text (e.g., 6 days, 23 hours, 45 minutes, 13 seconds). "Yes" mixed text is fine if you are only looking at a handful of agreements but if one is trying to run any type of metric reports and filter that data in Excel then the mixed text is useless. (2) Also, the use of "Business Days" is problematic for the following reasons: what exactly is a Business Day — US Federal Holidays excluded (why US and not Canada, Mexico, or some other country), State holidays excluded (which State), weekends excluded, does a business day start at 9am and en at 5pm and what time zone, what happens when a contract is submitted in Conga at 5:01pm on Friday and all work flow steps are completed and agreement executed at 5:03pm on Friday - if we are going by Business Day then how is that reported in the duration report?


HOW DO YOU FEEL THE REQUESTED FUNCTIONALITY WILL ALLOW YOU TO RESOLVE YOUR ISSUE?

Duration reports should automatically be reported in Conga as a numeric value only that can be filtered by Excel so that true metric reports on how long a particular "Flow Step" took can be reported. Also, there are way too many variables with "Business Days" as a time period - get rid of business days and just use a 24 hour period.


Call me to discuss if I was unclear or if further information is needed. From my position, this is not really an "enhancement" but correcting an error in that is preventing true and useful metric duration reports from being created.

content:

title: The ability to create draft requests as another user through the API so that when I use the API to fill out a request, that request is shown under that users request list.
author: Joshua Van Tassel
content: The typical way this is achieved is by logging in as the user who we want the request to be under but that requires that user to have a local account. Our users are all logging in through Okta Single Sign On and they do not have a username and password we can use to get a session. title: Drag multiple additional fields at once

author: Andrew Shriver
content:

author: Angel Guma

Customer would like to add a setting that can enable those emails to be included in the messaging thread if they are received.

author: Jake Teixeira
content: When you click the dropdown arrow next to the search button when on the All Contracts page or the "All Companies" page, the fields listed are not in alphabetical order and are in a different order depending on the user. title: Would like for date fields to be included in the search filters dropdown on the All Contracts page
author: Jake Teixeira

author: Jake Teixeira
content:
The search bar would be great if you could search within all available columns. The created date and the created by columns are not searchable. In fact, only these are:

title: Contract tree navigation
author: Chloe Bevan
content: When you're in a contract tree, after looking at a particular contract, there is no function to take you back to the contract tree or contract family tree you were viewing and so you have to redo the search, ie you have to click on the company hyperlink again to bring up the Contract Tree view and then you have to repeat the process of scrolling through the contract tree to get back to that contract family or using the 'Agreement' filter to get back to that contract family tree. A back function would be great. (In the Users List, there is a "Back to Browse" command.)

title: Filtering columns in Contract List view
author: Chloe Bevan
content: Adding a filter menu to the various fields/display columns of the Contract List view, especially the Agreement Type field – akin to the data filtering function in Excel which allows you to filter on multiple values. In the Contract Tree view it is possible to filter on the Contract Status and Agreement Type metadata fields. Currently the metadata fields (in the Contract List view) can only be displayed in ascending or descending order and you can only select one metadata field on which to perform that filter function. (Some companies have over a 1,000 contract profiles, so it can take a while to scroll through all the records to find the one you want.)

title: Uploading documents once to multiple places
author: Chloe Bevan
content: Are there plans to add a facility so that a particular document only needs to be uploaded once to multiple yet connected contract profiles? Eg I was asked just the other day to add the same agreement as a child document to three different contracts (in different contract family trees) in the same contract tree/of the same company. This required creating three new contract profiles and inputting the same metadata.

title: Link Contracts
author: Chloe Bevan
content: Being able to link contracts - 'sister contracts' ('spider' relationships), ie where one contract does not have the same parties as another contract but is nonetheless linked. For example: 1) A lease is between the lessor company and the lessee company. The lessor company, or a different company within the lessor group, then has a contract with a government body. This contract is intrinsically linked to the lease but the lessee is not a party to this contract, so technically/legally the 'Additional Parties' feature isn't the appropriate feature. 2) Or the lessor may have a parent company guarantee from the lessee's parent but the lessee is not party to this document.

title: Notification control

Currently, if a form is marked as required, but not fields are required, the form can be submitted. This can help a business process by potentially not needing as many request forms, so that end users might not get confused if there are numerous choices.

title: The ability to add the ‘Missing Parent’ tickbox to a request form.
author: Joshua Van Tassel
content:
I understand that by design, the 'Missing Parent' tickbox (which relates to the field Agreement Type/Agreement Link) cannot appear on a request form. It only appears on editing the contract profile. I would like to request the ability to add the tickbox to a request form (much like you would add a field to the request form if you need it there). It seems odd that you can allow Agreement Link field to be on the request form as a field, but then not the related functionality of the tickbox.

The ability for me as an admin to simply add the 'Missing Parent' tickbox to the request forms would mean that all requestors could then use it to express when the parent is not actually in the system. The current workaround is that once it reaches our Legal Contract Managers in the workflow (who have Full Access) they have to edit the contract profile and need to have heard from the Contract Owner (requestor) what they should update regarding the parent contract. Our Contract Owners are casual users are do not have edit permissions on contract profiles – otherwise after submitting the request they could be changing critical fields without Legal team's knowledge.

title: Make Smart Search smarter by allowing a user to determine whether or not "fuzzy" match in search results

content:
As of Summer '21 release, Conga supports a new Smart Search which allows us to do full-text search of documents and include agreement meta data in the search results. This works pretty well. However, the search results always include fuzzy search matches of similar keywords. When we know the exact term that we are looking for, we need to be able to disable the fuzzy match option and instead only include exact search hits.

The Smart Search seems to know which search hits are from the fuzzy match because there is red text on some search results with this text, "The document was found based on keyword relevance / fuzzy type search. Unable to find exact match of the search text within the document."

We would like the ability to exclude any results from the search that have this red text. This would make the "Smart Search" much smarter.

title: Enhance Ability to Update Responsibilities on a Contract
author: Emma Galvin
content:
There is a question as to how the application should behave in the case of a contract reassignment. Currently when a contract is reassigned from one company to another the responsibilities are kept as they are, in particular an assignment to a company person is now assigned to a person at a company that is no longer a party to the contract and who is therefore ineligible to be reselected as fulfilling that responsibility.

This issue could be resolved in multiple ways, either by removing responsible persons from the contract who are not eligible after reassignment or by moving those persons to the new company. However, both of those options present problems - in the first case, the contract cannot be resaved in the case of required responsibilities now being unfilled, and in the second case it may not be correct that the person has moved to the new company along with the contract. Both of these options also are a breaking change in the application.

title: Visual Summary of CLM/CPQ lifecycle on a timeline.
author: SF Integration Service Account
content:
I would start this idea with a quote from Mark Twain "There is no such thing as a new idea. It is impossible. We simply take a lot of old ideas and put them into a sort of mental kaleidoscope. We give them a turn and they make new and curious combinations. We keep on turning and making new combinations indefinitely; but they are the same old pieces of colored glass that have been in use through all the ages."


This idea is inspired from this "Time Warp" app on appexchange - https://appexchange.salesforce.com/appxListingDetail?listingId=a0N3u00000ONnm7EAD

title: Proposed clause library enhancements Export, Copy clauses, Notes Field, Clause Owner, Review Date
author: SF Integration Service Account
content:
1. Ability to export the clause library (current revisions only)- when you do a search query all the revisions show up and some of the clauses are missing

4. Ability to assign a Clause Owner so that we can identify an owner for revisions and periodic reviews
5. Ability to add a "last reviewed" date (different from a revision date)- to have the clause owner review their clauses on a periodic basis (this would be for clauses that are regulatory in nature, for us).

What problem do you intend to resolve with the requested functionality?
As an Admin, I would like to be able to do a comprehensive review of the clauses, assign an owner (from the business) and create a periodic review (especially for the regulatory clauses)


How do you feel the requested functionality will allow you to resolve your issue?

Export- see the clauses side by side for comparison

Copy clauses- saves work

Notes field- removes clutter in the plug in screen

Clause Owner and Reviewed date would help manage the clause for current application- focusing on the clauses that have not been reviewed in more than a year.
